newsitem.title: HONDURAS: Honduran protesters trap 100 government workers.
newsitem.headline: Honduran protesters trap 100 government workers.

text.p: Honduran Economy Minister Fernando Garcia and more than 100 other government workers were trapped inside the Economy Ministry on Monday after protesters angry at the rising cost of living blocked the building's exits.

"We are going to stay here until the minister receives us and responds to the document in which we seek the establishment of set rates for public services, transport and basic consumer goods," Francisco Izaguirre, president of the Federation of Independent Employers, told Reuters.
Hondouras is among the worst off countries in the hemisphere. Some 80 percent of the 5.9 million Hondurans live in poverty. Inflation of 24.9 percent in 1996 ate into their meager earnings.
Political analysts for months have been warning of a possible "social explosion" in Honduras because of grueling economic conditions for the poor.
